title: How to Get D Dog in Metal Gear Solid V

steps.title: Finish Mission/Episode 2.
steps.content: Finish Mission/Episode 2. During this mission, Ocelot will introduce Mother Base as well as other game mechanics to you. One of these game mechanics is the use of the Fulton Recovery System. Without this, there’s no way that you can hope to extract D-Dog in the next step.

steps.title: Start Episode 4.
steps.content: Start Episode 4. After completing Episode 3, have your helicopter pick you up at your Command Platform and proceed to your Aerial Command Center (ACC). Once at the ACC, you’ll need to open up your iDroid and go to your mission list to choose Episode 4: C2W. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Choose the Landing Zone.
steps.content: Choose the Landing Zone. When taking on this mission for the first time, you are presented with only one option for your landing zone. Drop over this landing zone to start the mission.

steps.title: Listen for a puppy’s barking.
steps.content: Listen for a puppy’s barking. You should hear a puppy barking right after you disembark from your chopper. The noise will almost always originate near the tree that’s closest to where you landed. Go ahead and move to the location of the noise and you should find a cute puppy wagging it’s tail at you.

steps.title: Tranquilize and extract the puppy.
steps.content: Tranquilize and extract the puppy. Take out your tranquilizing pistol and shoot the puppy. After he falls asleep, get close to him so that you can then extract him using the Fulton Recovery System. [2] X Research source If you listen to Miller’s instructions over your iDroid at the start of this mission, he will inform you of the puppy’s presence.

steps.title: Take on additional missions and side-ops.
steps.content: Take on additional missions and side-ops. Now that you’ve extracted D-Dog, you will need to wait a while for him to grow up. While waiting for this to happen, take on the main story missions and side ops first. Ocelot will ask you to get back to Mother Base to check on D-Dog’s growth twice. The first time is usually after you complete Episode 5 and some side ops. The second time you get called back will be sometime before Episode 7 or 8, and you should now have D-Dog available as your buddy.

steps.title: Develop your bond with D-Dog.
steps.content: Develop your bond with D-Dog. As soon as he’s available, make sure to take D-Dog with you on missions. By doing this, you get to increase your bond level with your buddy. Doing so will also unlock development for equipment that will allow D-Dog to kill, stun, and even use the Fulton Recovery System on enemies and vehicles. [3] X Research source
